alert.note: Alert for Fisher; Nolan; Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 25 at 7:38PM CDT until April 25 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN NOLAN...NORTHWESTERN TAYLOR AND SOUTHEASTERN FISHER COUNTIES... At 736 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Lake Sweetwater, or 8 miles southwest of Trent, moving southeast at 25 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR LAKE SWEETWATER AND NORTHEAST NOLAN COUNTY. HAZARD...Baseball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Nolan, northwestern Taylor and southeastern Fisher Counties, including the following locations... Lake Sweetwater and Camp Butman. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 243 and 272. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
